bibl.title: Peter Nelson et al v. Lewis V Wycoff. Civil
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

person.persName: Nelson Peter, Smith W, Elsner H, Whaley C, Mattson G, Lundblad Charles, Coffrey Dennis & Annir Jacob

div1.p: In the Distrist Court of the 3d Judisial Distrist of Washington Territory held at Seattle in and for the counties of King Kitsap and Snohomish
In the matter of the application of Peter Nelson, W Smith H Elsner C Whaley G Mattson Charles Lundblad Dennis Coffrey & Jacob Annir for a writ of Habeas Corpus } Petition for writ
To the Honorable J.R. Lewis Judge of the said Distrist Court
he petition ofPeter Nelson, W Smith H Elsner C Whaley G Mattson Charles Lundblad Dennis Coffrey & Jacob Annir

That they are unlawfully imprisoned detained and confined, and restrained of thier liberty by Louis V Wyskoff Sheriff of said County of King, at the County jail in said County of King and Territory of Washington

That the cause or pretense
for which they are so imprisoned as aforesaid is disobediense of orders and the lawful Commons of the Master and officers of the Bark Bern of the osean, in the harbour of Seattle while said vessel was lying at anchor dissharging ballast as mariners on board of the said Bark.
The the said imprisonment and restraint is illegal in this way:
1st There has been no regular and proper charge made against them of any affense known to the law
2d They have never been examined and held to bail by any competent offiser or authority
3 They have never been regularly or properly commited for any particular or definite offense or any offense known to the law
4 They have commited no offense whatever.
Wherefore your petitioners pray that a writ of Habeas Corpus
